info.name: Balance Flow API
info.description:
Complete API collection for Balance Flow backend application

## Language Support

This collection supports both Vietnamese (vi) and English (en) responses.

To change the language:
1. Go to **Variables** tab in this collection
2. Change the `locale` variable value:
   - `vi` for Vietnamese (default)
   - `en` for English

All API requests will automatically use your selected language via the `Accept-Language` header.

variable.description: Language preference (vi for Vietnamese, en for English)

item.name: Category Icons

request.description:
Get list of default category icons.

Returns:
- success: boolean
- data: array of icons with:
  - name: icon name (without extension)
  - filename: full filename
  - url: full URL to icon file

Available icons:
- Income: salary, bonus, investment, freelance, savings, other-income
- Expense: food, shopping, transportation, housing, healthcare, education, entertainment, utilities, insurance, gift, other-expense

item.description:
Category Icons endpoints.

Provides list of default icons that can be used when creating categories.

All endpoints require authentication via Bearer token.

item.name: Categories

query.description: Filter by type: income or expense (enable to filter)

request.description:
Get categories (system + user's custom) with pagination.

Query Parameters:
- `per_page` (optional): Number of items per page (default: 15)
- `type` (optional): Filter by category type (income|expense)

Examples:
- All categories: /api/categories
- Income only: /api/categories?type=income
- Expense only: /api/categories?type=expense

Response includes:
- success: boolean
- data: array of categories with:
  - subcategories_count: number of child categories
  - children: array of subcategories (max 2 levels: parent & child)
- pagination: current_page, per_page, total, last_page, from, to

Note: Categories support 2-level hierarchy (parent with children). Only parent categories (parent_id = null) include the 'children' array.

Get details of a specific category by ID.

Returns:
- success: boolean
- data: category object with all fields

formdata.description: Custom icon file (SVG, PNG, JPG - max 512KB). Takes priority over 'icon' field.

request.description:
Create a new user category.

Required fields:
- name: string (max 255)
- category_type: enum (income|expense)

Optional fields:
- parent_id: UUID of parent category (to create subcategory)
- icon: string (default icon name, e.g., 'salary.svg')
- icon_file: file (SVG, PNG, JPG - max 512KB)

Icon options:
1. Use 'icon' field with default icon name (e.g., 'salary.svg')
2. Upload custom icon via 'icon_file' field
3. icon_file takes priority over icon if both provided

Validation:
- Name is required
- Category type must be income or expense
- Parent must exist and have same type
- Parent cannot already have a parent (max 2 levels)

formdata.description: Custom icon file (SVG, PNG, JPG - max 512KB)

request.description:
Create a subcategory under a parent category.

Required:
- name: string (max 255)
- category_type: must match parent's type
- parent_id: UUID of parent category (must be a parent, not another subcategory)

Optional:
- icon: string (default icon name)
- icon_file: file (SVG, PNG, JPG - max 512KB)

Validation:
- Parent category cannot already have a parent (prevents 3+ levels)
- Subcategory type must match parent type
- Subcategories cannot have their own children

formdata.description: Method override for file upload support
Custom icon file (SVG, PNG, JPG - max 512KB). Takes priority over 'icon' field.

request.description:
Update an existing user category.

Use form-data with _method=PUT to support file upload.

Optional fields:
- name: string (max 255)
- icon: string (default icon name)
- icon_file: file (SVG, PNG, JPG - max 512KB)

Note:
- Cannot update system categories (is_system = true)
- Can only update own categories
- icon_file takes priority over icon if both provided
- Old icon file is deleted when new icon is uploaded
- Cannot change user_id or is_system

Delete a user category.

Restrictions:
- Cannot delete system categories
- Cannot delete own categories that have subcategories
- Cannot delete categories with transactions (future feature)
- Can only delete own categories

Get all subcategories of a parent category.

Returns:
- success: boolean
- data: array of subcategories

item.description:
Category management endpoints.

All endpoints require authentication via Bearer token.

Categories can be:
- System categories (is_system = true): Created by admin, cannot be modified/deleted
- User categories (is_system = false): Created by users, can be modified/deleted

Category types:
- income: For income transactions
- expense: For expense transactions

Category hierarchy:
- Maximum 2 levels: parent and child (subcategories)
- Parent categories (parent_id = null) can have multiple children
- Subcategories (parent_id != null) cannot have children
- Parent categories include 'children' array and 'subcategories_count' in response
- Attempting to create 3+ levels will result in validation error

item.name: Authentication

exec: console.log('User ID saved for verification: ' + response.data.user.id);

request.description:
Register a new user account.

Required fields:
- name: string (max 255)
- email: string (valid email, unique)
- password: string (min 8 characters)
- password_confirmation: string (must match password)

On success:
- Returns user data and access token
- Access token is automatically saved to collection variables

Login with email and password.

Required fields:
- email: string (valid email)
- password: string

On success:
- Returns user data and access token
- Access token is automatically saved to collection variables

Get authenticated user details.

Requires authentication via Bearer token.

Returns:
- User information (id, name, email, etc.)

Update user profile information.

Requires authentication via Bearer token.

Optional fields:
- name: string (max 255)
- email: string (valid email, unique)

Returns updated user information.

Change user password.

Requires authentication via Bearer token.

Required fields:
- current_password: string
- new_password: string (min 8 characters)
- new_password_confirmation: string (must match new_password)

On success:
- All tokens are revoked (user must login again)
- Returns success message

Logout from current device.

Requires authentication via Bearer token.

Revokes current access token only.
User remains logged in on other devices.

Logout from all devices.

Requires authentication via Bearer token.

Revokes all access tokens.
User must login again on all devices.

Request password reset link.

Required fields:
- email: string (must exist in database)

Sends password reset link to user's email.

Reset password using token from email.

Required fields:
- token: string (from reset email)
- email: string
- password: string (min 8 characters)
- password_confirmation: string (must match password)

On success:
- All tokens are revoked
- User must login with new password

Verify email address using link from email.

Required fields:
- id: string (user UUID from email link)
- hash: string (SHA1 hash from email link)

Email verification link format:
/api/auth/verify-email?id={user_id}&hash={hash}

On success:
- Sets email_verified_at timestamp
- Returns success message

Note: In development, email is logged to storage/logs/laravel.log

Resend email verification notification.

Requires authentication via Bearer token.

Sends new verification email to user's email address.

Returns error if email is already verified.

Note: In development, email is logged to storage/logs/laravel.log

item.description:
Authentication endpoints - ✅ Fully Implemented

Phase 1 - Priority: High

Using Laravel Sanctum for token-based authentication.

Public endpoints (no auth required):
- POST /auth/register
- POST /auth/login
- POST /auth/forgot-password
- POST /auth/reset-password
- POST /auth/verify-email

Protected endpoints (require Bearer token):
- GET /auth/me
- PUT /auth/profile
- PUT /auth/password
- POST /auth/logout
- POST /auth/logout-all
- POST /auth/resend-verification-email

Email Verification Flow:
1. User registers → Receives verification email
2. User clicks link in email → Calls /verify-email with id + hash
3. If email not received → Calls /resend-verification-email

All responses follow standard format:
{
  "success": true/false,
  "message": "Message in Vietnamese",
  "data": {...}
}
